SEARCH
Package com.csse3200.game.components.cards

Class Hand

java.lang.Object
com.csse3200.game.components.cards.Hand
public class Hand extends Object
Represents a single hand of cards in a Blackjack game.

A Hand holds a list of Card objects and provides methods for calculating its total value, determining if it can be split or doubled, and checking for special conditions such as blackjack or bust.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hand

      public Hand()
      Constructs a new, empty Hand. The hand starts with no cards and is not doubled.

      Adds a card to this hand.
      Parameters:

    • resetHand

      public void resetHand()
      Removes all cards from this hand, resetting it to empty.

    • getCards

      public List<Card> getCards()
      Returns the list of cards in this hand.
      Returns:
      the list of Card objects in the hand

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if this hand currently contains no cards.
      Returns:
      true if the hand is empty, false otherwise

    • setDoubled

      public void setDoubled(boolean bool)
      Marks this hand as doubled or not doubled.
      Parameters:
      bool - true to mark the hand as doubled, false otherwise

    • isDoubled

      public boolean isDoubled()
      Checks whether this hand has been doubled.
      Returns:
      true if doubled, false otherwise

    • getValue

      public int getValue()
      Calculates the total numeric value of this hand, handling Aces appropriately.

      Aces count as either 1 or 11, whichever results in the highest possible value that does not exceed 21.

      Returns:
      the total hand value according to Blackjack rules

    • isBust

      public boolean isBust()
      Determines whether this hand is bust (value exceeds 21).
      Returns:
      true if the hand's value exceeds 21, false otherwise

    • isBlackjack

      public boolean isBlackjack()
      Checks if this hand is a blackjack.

      A blackjack occurs when the hand contains exactly two cards and their total value equals 21.

      Returns:
      true if the hand is a blackjack, false otherwise

    • canSplit

      public boolean canSplit()
      Determines whether this hand can be split into two hands.

      A hand can be split if it contains exactly two cards of equal value.

      Returns:
      true if the hand can be split, false otherwise

    • canDouble

      public boolean canDouble()
      Checks whether this hand is eligible for a double down action.

      A hand can be doubled if it contains exactly two cards.

      Returns:
      true if the hand can be doubled, false otherwise

    • remove

      public void remove(Card card)
      Removes a specific card from the hand.
      Parameters:
      card - the Card to remove
